qas.question: For whom did Paul VI work for from 1922 to 1954?
In what year did Paul VI issue a regulation?
With whom did Paul VI issue a regulation in 1968?
What did Paul Vi's reforms reduce in the Curia?
Whose representation was enlarged through reforms in the Curia?

context: Pope Paul VI knew the <a0_0>Roman Curia<a0_0/> well, having worked there for a generation from 1922 to 1954. He implemented his reforms in stages, rather than in one fell swoop. On 1 March <a1_0>1968<a1_0/>, he issued a regulation, a process that had been initiated by Pius XII and continued by John XXIII. On 28 March, with <a2_0>Pontificalis Domus<a2_0/>, and in several additional Apostolic Constitutions in the following years, he revamped the entire Curia, which included reduction of <a3_0>bureaucracy<a3_0/>, streamlining of existing congregations and a broader representation of <a4_0>non-Italians<a4_0/> in the curial positions.
